Second, be sure to place a widget on your home screen. Once you\'ve done this, just tap the widget to change the ring mode. The widget will show which mode is active (normal, vibrate, or silent).
Controlling the ring state with calendar events

If you want your phone to enter Do Not Disturb mode during an event in your Google calendar, add either #RC# or #RingControl# to the event\'s title or description (to set the phone to vibrate instead, use #RC/V# or #RingControl/V#). You should do this at least one hour prior to the event\'s start. The mode will change approximately one minute prior to the event\'s start, and revert back to the original setting after the event. Events must be less than 24 hours, and cannot be all-day.

Remember, you need to give the app permission to read your calendar. If you didn\'t do this when you first ran the app, do the following: go to Settings, go to Apps, find the Ring Control App, and under Permissions set Calendar to allowed.
